verses.verse: So he shepherded them according to the (1 Kin. 9:4) integrity of his heart, And guided them by the skillfulness of his hands.

(A Dirge and a Prayer for Israel, Destroyed by Enemies) A Psalm of Asaph. [1] O God, the nations have come into (Ps. 74:2) Your inheritance; Your holy temple they have defiled; (2 Kin. 25:9, 10; 2 Chr. 36:17-19; Jer. 26:18; 52:12-14; Mic. 3:12) They have laid Jerusalem in heaps.
(Deut. 28:26; Jer. 7:33; 19:7; 34:20) The dead bodies of Your servants They have given as food for the birds of the heavens, The flesh of Your saints to the beasts of the earth.
Their blood they have shed like water all around Jerusalem, And there was no one to bury them.
We have become a reproach to our (Ps. 44:13; (Dan. 9:16)) neighbors, A scorn and derision to those who are around us.
(Ps. 74:1, 9) How long, LORD? Will You be angry forever? Will Your ((Zeph. 3:8)) jealousy burn like fire?
(Jer. 10:25; (Zeph. 3:8)) Pour out Your wrath on the nations that (Is. 45:4, 5; 1 Thess. 4:5; (2 Thess. 1:8)) do not know You, And on the kingdoms that (Ps. 53:4) do not call on Your name.
For they have devoured Jacob, And laid waste his dwelling place.
(Is. 64:9) Oh, do not remember former iniquities against us! Let Your tender mercies come speedily to meet us, For we have been brought very low.
Help us, O God of our salvation, For the glory of Your name; And deliver us, and provide atonement for our sins, (Jer. 14:7, 21) For Your name’s sake!
(Ps. 42:10) Why should the nations say, “Where is their God?” Let there be known among the nations in our sight The avenging of the blood of Your servants which has been shed.
Let (Ps. 102:20) the groaning of the prisoner come before You; According to the greatness of Your power Preserve those who are appointed to die;
And return to our neighbors (Gen. 4:15; Lev. 26:21; Prov. 6:31; Is. 30:26) sevenfold into their bosom (Ps. 74:10, 18, 22) Their reproach with which they have reproached You, O Lord.
So (Ps. 74:1; 95:7) we, Your people and sheep of Your pasture, Will give You thanks forever; (Is. 43:21) We will show forth Your praise to all generations.

(Prayer for Israel’s Restoration) To the Chief Musician. (Ps. 45:title) Set to “The Lilies.” A Testimony of Asaph. A Psalm. [1] Give ear, O Shepherd of Israel, ((Ex. 25:20-22); 1 Sam. 4:4; 2 Sam. 6:2) You who lead Joseph (Ps. 77:20) like a flock; You who dwell between the cherubim, (Deut. 33:2) shine forth!
Before (Ps. 78:9, 67) Ephraim, Benjamin, and Manasseh, Stir up Your strength, And come and save us!
(Lam. 5:21) Restore us, O God; (Num. 6:25; Ps. 4:6) Cause Your face to shine, And we shall be saved!
O LORD God of hosts, (Ps. 79:5) How long will You be angry Against the prayer of Your people?
(Ps. 42:3; Is. 30:20) You have fed them with the bread of tears, And given them tears to drink in great measure.
